title: What jazz song (or style) is heard in the background of this scene? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s extremely modern big band jazz of the sort you hear in such Japanese anime as Cowboy Bebop. But it’s big band jazz with something quite singular besides, a good deal of theater added. a good deal of exaggeration. I wouldn’t be surprised if the same person who composed the music to Cowboy Bebop composed this as well. It seems to have his stamp upon it. But it does seem to me to represent a quite singular approach to the big band sound. More accurate than calling it a “style,” perhaps, would be to call it a style setter, swinging and exciting.

I’d say this is a bit jazzy. The instrumentation sounds like a bit like a stripped back big band vamping over one chord. The drum beat is reminiscent of Benny Goodman’s Sing Sing Sing, but at a faster tempo. Other might or might not agree, but I’m getting a Charles Mingus vibe from it. The tempo is fast enough that eighth notes tend to be straighter, rather than “swung”, but there is some syncopation there that I would argue most rock tunes don’t have.
Sounds like 40s jump swing, but that drummer… oy.
